identificationModule.briefTitle: Compound Edaravone Injection for Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Compound Edaravone Injection for Acute Ischemic Stroke, a Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Multi-dose, Parallel, and Controlled Phase II Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
1. To investigate the efficacy and safety of multi-doses Compound Edaravone Injection versus Edaravone Injection for acute ischemic stroke patients;
2. To provide evidence for the design of Compound Edaravone Injection Phase III trial.

armGroups.label: Low-dose group
armGroups.description: Compound Edaravone Injection, 12.5mg/dose (Edaravone 10mg, (+)-Borneol 2.5mg), one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days

armGroups.label: Medium-dose group
armGroups.description: Compound Edaravone Injection, 37.5mg/dose (Edaravone 30mg, (+)-Borneol 7.5mg), one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days

armGroups.label: High-dose group
armGroups.description: Compound Edaravone Injection, 62.5mg/dose (Edaravone 50mg, (+)-Borneol 12.5mg), one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Edaravone Injection，30 mg/dose, one dose every 12 hours, continues for 14 days

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline NIHSS score on day 14

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of patients with NIHSS score 0-1 (including motor function) on day 14, 30, 90
The proportion of patients with Barthel Index (BI) score greater than or equal to 95 on day 14, 30, 90
The Montreal Cognitive Assessment(MoCA) score on day 14, 30, 90
Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) score on day 90

references.citation: Xu J, Wang Y, Wang A, Gao Z, Gao X, Chen H, Zhou J, Zhao X, Wang Y. Safety and efficacy of Edaravone Dexborneol versus edaravone for patients with acute ischaemic stroke: a phase II, multicentre, randomised, double-blind, multiple-dose, active-controlled clinical trial. Stroke Vasc Neurol. 2019 Apr 22;4(3):109-114. doi: 10.1136/svn-2018-000221. eCollection 2019 Sep.
